results.title: Enthronement of the Archbishop of York
results.brief_description: Some of the recordings made at the enthronement of Archbishop Coggan in York Minster from the arrival of the Archbishop through to his installation and enthronement. Some explanation of cathedral traditions is given in the commentary.

results.title: Enthalpy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structure Bonding and the Periodic Law”.
Professor Haynes of Open University explains the procedures involved in the National Physical Laboratory’s equipment to determine enthalpy changes. The process is compared to home/school laboratory calorimeters and used to discuss the theory of and problems associated with measuring energy changes in chemical reactions.

results.title: Entertainment storytelling
results.creator_credit: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Video tech”.
This program allows the viewer to consolidate what they have learned in the other episodes of the series and apply these to the production of an entertainment story. Follow the production of an actual story from the initial stages of choosing and developing an idea, researching the background, planning work which has to be done on the shoot, getting the shots needed for the story, shotlisting, and doing an interview through to post-production and the screening of the final product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions

results.title: Entertainment
results.creator_credit: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras looks at recreational activities in China. Cinema going is particularly popular and European and American films are being shown more frequently. The Peking Opera is a much loved and traditional art form, steeped in cultural heritage. Although it is not as popular amongst young Chinese, tourists love the rich pageantry. The Chinese also love outdoor events in parks and on waterways. The composition of Chinese characters in Chinese writing is also examined.

results.title: Entertaining with Isabel Jones
results.brief_description: Isabelle Jones, cookery broadcaster and journalist, shows you step-by-step how simple cooking and entertaining really is. This 60-minute video features four different menus for six people. Over 25 tried and tested, delicious recipes in the accompanying cover booklet. Table setting ideas, lots of cooking tips, quick and easy methods. Rated: G

results.title: Entertaining Mr. Sloane
results.creator_credit: Douglas Kentish, Canterbury Film Productions and Douglas Hickox
results.brief_description: Joe Orton’s plays eroticised the “kitchen-sink” realist theatre of the 1960s. In “Entertaining Mr. Sloane” a young man lodges with a safely bourgeois brother and sister (Harry Edwards and Beryl Reid) only to find that they are both interested in seducing him, and they will let nothing get in their way of satisfying their sexual desires. Though it is as theatre that Orton’s work is most successful, this film is still a satisfying translation of his work onto the screen. The cast is magnificent, especially the wonderful Beryl Reid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas Kentish, Canterbury Film Productions and Douglas Hickox

results.title: Entertaining angels
results.creator_credit: Elwood Kieser, Paulist Pictures and Michael Rhodes
results.brief_description: ‘Entertaining Angels’ is based on the true life of Dorothy Day, a radical journalist who lived in New York writing about the plight of America’s homeless. She has an early love affair with a co-worker which results in a traumatic abortion that sees her move to the coast to be alone. While staying at the beach Dorothy (Moira Kelly) comes across and old friend and the two fall in love. It is at this time that Dorothy begins to question her faith after some close contact with one of the nuns who runs a shelter for the disadvantaged. Dorothy falls pregnant to Foster and although happy for a while, she refuses to give up her religion and he refuses to marry, once again Dorothy is alone but ready to move back to the city. Dorothy and her daughter are baptized Catholics and Dorothy resumes her career as a journalist, only this time starting her own paper, “The Catholic Worker” after meeting Peter, a French social activist. Dorothy combines her journalism and charity at home, offering the homeless a soup kitchen, shelter and office where she can work on the paper. This is an inspiring film that was made on a relatively small budget by Paulist Pictures who also brought us ‘Romero’.

results.title: Enterprising women
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Shelagh Mackenzie, Barry Cowling, Hubert Schuurman and Lulu Keating
results.brief_description: By focusing on six female entrepreneurs, Enterprising Women captures the essence of what it means to own your own business: the pitfalls and the joys. Women are relatively new to the area of business ownership, but they’ve already demonstrated a high success rate in a variety of fields. The women profiled here run companies dealing in pasta, lumber, fish, silk-screening, and a business academy. Each one expresses her personal and business philosophies.

results.title: Enterprise in steam
results.creator_credit: Brian Bosisto, Bosisto Productions and John Dick
results.brief_description: The story of the Pichi Pichi Railway Preservation Society and their efforts in re-opening 32 kilometres of historical railway track at Quorn in South Australia’s northern region. Apart from showing the restoration of steam locomotive carriages and bridges the film shows the spirit of enterprise in a community

results.title: Enterprise in Nigeria
results.creator_credit: Gerard Holdsworth, Unilever Films and Sydney Latter
results.brief_description: Nigeria, formerly an agricultural country, has a growing range of new industries giving Africans new opportunities and training facilities. With independence the process of industrialisation has accelerated. Shows how the United Africa Company, contributing capital and techniques in many different fields, is playing a part in the rapid development of the country. Traces the growth of industry in all three regions of Nigeria.
